attributes.action: Give homeless people the right to vote
attributes.additional_details: If you don't have a home, you are still a person and under the basic convention of human rights, the right to vote is there clear as day. It also doesn't cause any significant problems as long as it is done correctly
attributes.background: Allow people to right N/A on an address if they do not have one allowing them to vote. If the government can do the process justice then this reform is revolutionary

rejection.details: People with no fixed or permanent address can already register to vote. The form for people of no fixed or permanent address to register to vote is available here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/register-to-vote-if-you-havent-got-a-fixed-or-permanent-address
